Dear Ms. Brewer:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents’ needs, implementation of treatment plans,
and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation All youth placed were not supervised and as a result were able to
barricade themselves inside a bedroom and almost started a fire.
Investigation The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 02/20/2024 during
an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She confirmed
involvement with the incident in question and stated it was she
and Staff 1 that were present that day. The Chief Administrator
recalled the day this occurred was an unexpected snow day, so all
the youth were at the home in the morning instead of in school.
The Chief Administrator stated she attempted to create some
activities and structure for the day, and this included creating two
groups of youth with the intent to have good group dynamics and
work on some negative relationships between certain youth. The
Chief Administrator stated all of the youth declined to participate
and almost immediately did not follow staff direction for the
morning. This resulted in Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D
going upstairs to the bedroom of Youth B and Youth D. The Chief
Administrator recalled at that time Youth A and Youth C were not
allowed to be in that room. She recalled asking the youth to leave
the bedroom and they refused. As the Chief Administrator and
Staff 1 attempted to communicate with the youth in the bedroom,
they would periodically open and close the door. The Chief
Administrator stated she provided the best line of sight supervision
that she could. The Chief Administrator recalled this portion of the
incident lasting a more extended amount of time and noted the
youth were not doing anything in particular other than engaging in
age appropriate conversations and interactions. The Chief
Administrator stated she traded off with Staff 1 for responsibility of
supervising the youth. The Chief Administrator recalled the youth
closed the door at one point when Staff 1 was supervising them,
and Staff 1 stated Law Enforcement would need to be called to do
2

a wellness check on the youth if the door was not ajar for her to
see them. The Chief Administrator believed the youth opened the
door for Staff 1 at that point. She stated she was downstairs for
this portion of the incident, and she came back upstairs to hear
the youth talking about doing each other’s hair. The Chief
Administrator stated they were using a pressing comb; an
electrical hair tool that uses heat to straighten hair. The Chief
Administrator recalled this tool was creating visible smoke. She
stated she stepped towards the doorway only for Youth B to tell
her to “Shut the fuck up” and slam the bedroom door. The Chief
Administrator stated the youth then pushed a bed in front of their
side of the door to barricade themselves in. She was not certain
this is what they did, but it was a reasonable speculation based on
what she heard them saying and doing on the other side of the
door. The Chief Administrator stated she was then concerned
about the youth’s activities inside the bedroom and with the recent
difficult dynamics between some of the youth, concerned about
the possibility that they would fight each other. To this point in the
incident there had not been any discord noted between the youth
involved. The Chief Administrator then called law enforcement to
report the activities and request assistance. It took a few minutes
for law enforcement to come to the scene, and the fire department
accompanied them because of the concern of smoke coming from
the pressing comb. The Chief Administrator believed the youth
may have come out of the room before law enforcement arrived at
the scene. At this point the youth had exited the bedroom and
they all spoke with the authorities. The Chief Administrator then
described further events of the day after this occurred, including
the same four youth attempting a group AWOL together after they
created a diversion for the Chief Administrator upstairs and Youth
C attempting to speak with boys that went to her school over the
phone, both of which were not successful.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 02/29/2024 during an announced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. She recalled being a part of the
incident in question. She stated Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and
Youth D had proceeded to go up to one of the bedrooms upstairs
during a snow day when they were all at home. Staff 1 recalled
the youth were not allowed to do this and there were other
activities attempted. The youth were not escalated or misbehaving
in any form at first. Staff 1 recalled the Chief Administrator asking
the youth to come out of that bedroom because it was against
house rules and the youth refused to comply. Staff 1 statedthe
four youth ended up in one of their bedrooms. She then sat out in
the hallway near the south wall of the upstairs. Staff 1 stated she
would get up from her chair every 15 minutes and look into the
3

bedroom to see what was occurring, the door had been opened
up to that point. Staff 1 recalled the Chief Administrator came
upstairs after having contact with the License Designee, and the
Chief Administrator asked the youth to stop using a pressing comb
to do each other’s hair as that was not an approved item for them
to have in their possession. Staff 1 stated the comb was
supposed to be stored in the salon room on the first floor of the
facility and she was not sure why it was in the youth’s possession.
Staff 1 stated she was not aware the youth were using that comb
at first but eventually it was evident because there was a smoking
smell coming from the room. Staff 1 recalled the youth then
slammed the bedroom door in the Chief Administrator’s face and
attempted to block entry to the bedroom by sliding a bed against
the door. Staff 1 also recalled the youth closing the door only for
Staff 1 to re-open it, and this occurred successively. Staff 1
recalled the fire department and law enforcement coming to the
facility at this point after the Chief Administrator had called them.
Saff 1 stated the youth came out of the room and spoke with law
enforcement and the fire department and they were de-escalated.
Youth E was interviewed on 02/29/2024 during an announced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated she was not in the
room with the other youth when this incident occurred because
she was quarantining in her own bedroom after being diagnosed
with COVID-19. Youth E stated she heard commotion and would
peak her head out of her bedroom on multiple occasions to see
what was going on. On several instances of doing this Youth E
stated she could see the bedroom door open and could hear the
other youth in this bedroom and saw Staff 1 sitting at the end of
the hallway. Youth E stated there was one specific time that she
did not see Staff 1 or the Chief Administrator upstairs with the
other youth.
Youth B was interviewed on 02/29/2024 during an announced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated she took part in the
incident in question. Youth B recalled being in the bedroom with
Youth A, Youth C and Youth D. Youth B stated she did not think
there was anything wrong with what she and her peers were doing
because they go in and out of each other’s bedrooms frequently.
Youth B stated she had a pressing comb in her possession during
her entire stay at the facility and no one had told her she could not
have it. Youth B stated she and Youth A, Youth C and Youth D
were doing each other’s hair on the morning in question and she
periodically saw Staff 1 and the Chief Administrator come in and
out of the bedroom they were in. Youth B recalled the Chief
Administrator seeing them do each other’s hair and use the
4

pressing comb and at one point commenting, “Okay, that looks
good” and “Y’all gonna continue to do your hair.” Youth B felt like
the Chief Administrator was “picking” on them as she later asked
them to stop and leave the room. As a result, she and the other
youth decided to close the door to the bedroom and push a bed
against it so staff could not come in. Youth B recalled Youth C
was using the pressing comb on Youth A’s hair. After this, Youth
B heard Staff 1 state to them law enforcement could be called if
the youth did not come out of the bedroom. Youth B stated no
one tried to open the bedroom door after they slid the bed against
it. Youth B stated a few minutes went by when she heard sirens
outside, and all of the youth came out of the room to go look out of
the front of the building, which can be seen through the south
window in the upstairs hallway. Youth B stated this was when she
saw law enforcement and the fire department outside. Youth B
stated she spoke with the fire department and law enforcement.
Youth C was interviewed over the phone at her new placement on
03/15/2024. She confirmed she was involved in the incident in
question. Youth C stated she was upstairs in a bedroom with
Youth A, Youth B and Youth D for most of the morning. She
recalled doing hair with the other youth, and one of the tools that
was used was a pressing comb. Youth C stated the Chief
Administrator came into the bedroom a couple times, and another
staff member that she could not recall would stick her head in and
say “Just checking in” every 15 minutes or so. She recalled one
of the staff members asking them to not close the bedroom door.
Youth C then recalled that the Chief Administrator did ask them to
leave the bedroom when they first went upstairs but the youth
chose not to. Youth C did not believe either staff had told them
not to use the pressing comb and that it was already in the room
when they came upstairs. Youth C recalled the bed being pushed
against the door to the bedroom to not allow staff to come in, and
then shortly thereafter the fire department came to the house to
speak with the youth. Youth C stated she left the bedroom at this
point.
Documents reviewed:
• An Incident Report dated 02/15/2024 was provided and
reviewed. This was authored by the Chief
Administrator. This incident report is consistent with the
interview provided by the Chief Administrator. It detailed
that several youth were in a bedroom unauthorized and that
staff had asked them to leave several times. The youth
were asked to unplug the straightening comb that was
being used, and this caused them to become upset. The
5

youth refused and they put a bed behind the door to
prevent access. 911 was contacted to request assistance
with a wellness check and they were informed there was a
smoke smell coming from the closed bedroom. Law
enforcement and the fire department arrived at the facility
shortly thereafter.
• Security camera footage of parts of the incident was
provided and viewed. Because of the limitations of the
facility’s camera system there were only 20 second clips
available. The video clips showed youth coming and going
from bedrooms upstairs and Staff 1 was upstairs in the
hallway. The clips culminate with footage of three of the
youth coming out of a bedroom to come to the window at
the end of the hallway, and the youth then witnessed law
enforcement arriving to the house. It was not apparent that
there was a staff member present upstairs for the entirety
of the incident. A clip minutes later showed the Chief
Administrator upstairs with law enforcement.
• Youth B’s case file was reviewed and there was no
documentation found that indicated a list of prohibited items
was provided to her including a similar hair product to the
one involved in the incident.
o A template form for the facilities “Intake Checklist”
was provided and reviewed. On this lists items that
are not allowed in the facility, but nothing similar to
the hair straightening tool is included in this list. In
addition, this form is kept in the case file for the
youth, and it was not clear this was provided directly
to the youth for their information at intake.
• Facility policy dated 01/14/2024 was reviewed.
o A section of this policy titled “Care & Safety”
describes the supervision requirements of staff. This
policy stated “The primary job of all staff is to always
maintain adequate coverage and line of sight of all
youth. This means that youth are never left
unattended for any amount of time so that behaviors
are supervised.”
o In the same section it was described that “no
resident is to enter another resident’s room. The only
person’s that are allowed in the sleeping rooms will
be staff and the assigned youth. Therefore, no other
youth should be in another youth’s sleeping room.”
o There is no narrative in the facility policies and
procedures that outlines what items are prohibited in
the facility.
6

Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed there was evidence found that the facility did not follow
its own policies and procedures regarding the supervision of youth
when they were in an upstairs bedroom together.
Technical Assistance provided:
• The Chief Administrator reported that she and Staff 1 had
access to walkie talkies during the incident, but they were
not fully functional at that moment. Ensuring there are
backups for devices like these is advised.
• Clarity and documentation are needed for house rules.
Multiple youth in the investigation claimed they did not
know about house rules regarding who was allowed in what
bedroom or what items they were not allowed to have in
their possession, and written policy of this was not clear.
Consultation provided:
• During the interview with the Chief Administrator, she was
advised to instruct staff members who work overnights and
supervise the youth while sleeping to be mindful of where
they sit. If staff sit in a chair against the wall where the
security camera is located, they cannot be seen. If they sit
a few feet forward, they can be seen in security footage
and clarity would be achieved on whether they were
present or not during any given situation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000695 dated 10/05/2023, CAP approved11/16/2023.
SIR 2024C0001037SI dated 04/18/2024 CAP pending.
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Based on the findings in this report a CAP is required.
Per SIR #2024C0001037SI, a 1st provisional license is recommended.
